title: Steampunk Observatory Adventure #15
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Observation Deck
rooms.description: A circular chamber filled with brass telescopes and copper instruments. Gears tick rhythmically in the walls. Through the domed glass ceiling, stars twinkle in the night sky. Steam hisses from pipes running along the floor. A massive orrery dominates the center of the room, its planets slowly rotating on mechanical arms.

items.name: brass telescope
items.description: A large telescope mounted on a rotating base, pointed at the stars
items.text: Engraved on the base: 'Built in the year 1889 by Master Clockmaker Gideon Brass. May it reveal the secrets of the cosmos.'

items.name: instrument cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet with glass doors containing various astronomical tools and three drawers

items.name: astronomer's journal
items.description: A leather bound notebook filled with observations and calculations
items.text: Journal Entry: The observatory was completed in 1889, the same year I discovered the comet. My assistants are Cogsworth the engineer, Tesla the electrician, and young Ada the mathematician. The gear chamber holds my greatest invention.

items.name: copper key
items.description: A key made of polished copper with gear teeth along its edge

items.name: mechanical orrery
items.description: A complex clockwork model of the solar system with eight planets orbiting a central sun
items.text: A brass plaque reads: 'Eight planets circle our sun. Count them well, for their number unlocks secrets below.'

items.name: supply chest
items.description: A wooden chest reinforced with brass corners

items.name: maintenance log
items.description: A technical document detailing the observatory's systems
items.text: MAINTENANCE LOG: The roof mechanism requires the master control wheel from the gear chamber. Engineer Cogsworth maintains all mechanical systems. The control room password system was installed for security.

items.name: iron spiral staircase
items.description: A wrought iron staircase descending into the mechanical depths of the observatory

rooms.name: Gear Chamber
rooms.description: A cavernous room filled with massive rotating gears and spinning flywheels. Steam pipes cross the ceiling like metal veins. The rhythmic clanking of machinery echoes off the stone walls. Pressure gauges line one wall, and a large workbench sits covered in tools and blueprints. A reinforced vault door leads to the control room.

items.name: wall mounted gear mechanism
items.description: A complex arrangement of interlocking gears mounted on the wall
items.text: Each gear is labeled with a number. The largest gear shows '8' and appears to be the key to the system.

items.name: engineer's workbench
items.description: A sturdy workbench covered in tools, oil cans, and technical drawings

items.name: technical blueprint
items.description: A detailed schematic of the observatory's systems
items.text: OBSERVATORY SCHEMATIC: The control room houses the master telescope controls and roof opening mechanism. Access requires knowledge of: the chief engineer's name, the location of the master control wheel, and the builder's identity.

items.name: brass bound chest
items.description: A heavy chest bound with brass straps and secured with a combination lock showing eight numbered dials

items.name: master control wheel
items.description: A large brass wheel with intricate engravings, clearly an important component

items.name: engineer's note
items.description: A note written in precise handwriting
items.text: Note from Cogsworth: The master control wheel must be installed in the control room to operate the roof mechanism. Remember, the wheel is stored in the gear chamber for safekeeping.

items.name: pressure gauge panel
items.description: A panel of brass pressure gauges monitoring the steam systems
items.text: All gauges read normal. A small label reads: 'Maintained by Chief Engineer Cogsworth since 1889.'

items.name: tool rack
items.description: A rack holding various wrenches, hammers, and mechanical tools

items.name: reinforced vault door
items.description: A massive steel door with a security panel displaying three questions etched in brass

password_questions.question: Who is the chief engineer?
password_questions.hint: Check the pressure gauges and the astronomer's journal

password_questions.question: Where is the master control wheel stored?
password_questions.hint: The engineer's note mentions the storage location

password_questions.question: Who built this observatory?
password_questions.hint: Look at the engraving on the brass telescope

rooms.name: Observatory Control Room
rooms.description: You have reached the heart of the observatory! A magnificent control room with walls covered in switches, levers, and glowing vacuum tubes. In the center stands a pedestal with a socket for the master control wheel. Above, a massive steam powered roof mechanism waits to open the observatory dome to the stars. Through the windows, you can see the night sky waiting to be explored.

items.name: control pedestal
items.description: A brass pedestal with a wheel socket and activation lever
items.text: Instructions: Insert the master control wheel and pull the lever to open the observatory roof and complete your mission.

items.name: vacuum tube array
items.description: Rows of glowing tubes that power the observatory's electrical systems

items.name: master telescope controls
items.description: An elaborate control panel for operating the main telescope

rooms.win_message: You insert the master control wheel into the pedestal and pull the activation lever. With a tremendous hiss of steam and grinding of gears, the observatory roof splits open, revealing the magnificent starry sky above! The telescopes whir to life, and you have successfully restored the Steampunk Observatory to its full glory. The cosmos awaits your discoveries! You win!
